title: Jaipur
short_description: Immerse yourself in the grandeur of Rajputana architecture and vibrant bazaars in the Pink City.
long_description:
Jaipur, the Pink City, is India's first planned city and the capital of Rajasthan. Founded by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II in 1727, it is a mesmerizing blend of royal heritage and vibrant street life. The city's rosy hue dates back to 1876, when it was painted pink to welcome the Prince of Wales, a tradition that continues to this day.

Jaipur is home to some of the world's most luxurious palace hotels. From the sprawling gardens of Rambagh Palace, once the residence of the Maharaja, to the intimate courtyards of Samode Haveli, the options for a royal stay are unparalleled. The city offers a rich tapestry of experiences: exploring the Amber Fort on an elephant, gazing at the Hawa Mahal, shopping for gemstones in ancient bazaars, and dining on royal cuisine under the stars.

properties.title: Rambagh Palace
properties.short_description: The former residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur, offering 47 acres of royal gardens and unmatched luxury.

properties.title: Jai Mahal Palace
properties.short_description: A 275-year-old masterpiece of Indo-Saracenic architecture set amidst 18 acres of Mughal gardens.

properties.title: The Raj Palace
properties.short_description: An award-winning heritage hotel that was one of the city's first palaces, featuring breathtaking Durbar halls.

properties.title: Samode Haveli
properties.short_description: A deeply atmospheric haveli with secret courtyards and intricate frescoes, hidden in the heart of the old city.

properties.title: Suj√°n Rajmahal Palace
properties.short_description: Known for its stunning wallpapers and art deco interiors, this is where modern design meets royal heritage.

properties.title: Alsisar Haveli
properties.short_description: A traditional nobleman's home converted into a hotel, offering a peaceful retreat with vibrant Rajasthani flavour.

properties.title: ITC Rajputana
properties.short_description: Designed to mirror local traditional havelis, this luxury hotel offers red brick architecture and courtyards.

properties.title: Narain Niwas Palace
properties.short_description: Built in 1928, this palace showcases a unique blend of Anglo-Indian architecture and is home to the famous Bar Palladio.

how_to_reach: Jaipur is part of the Golden Triangle. Book a flight to Jaipur International Airport or take the Shatabdi Express from Delhi.
seo_title: Best Heritage Hotels in Jaipur | Royal Luxury Stays
seo_description: Stay in Jaipur's finest palaces including Rambagh Palace, Jai Mahal, and Samode Haveli. Verified royal experiences in the Pink City.
